ColumnA: Incorrect administration or interpretation of test HIV Recent TB infection (within 8–10 weeks of exposure) Severe forms of TB (e.g. disseminated TB, TB meningitis) Viral infections (e.g. measles, varicella, Epstein– Barr virus) Vaccinated with live viral vaccines (within 6 weeks) Malnutrition Bacterial infection (e.g. typhoid, leprosy, pertussis) Immunosuppressive medicines (e.g. corticosteroids) Neonates and infants aged <6 months Primary immunodeficiencies Diseases of lymphoid tissue (e.g. Hodgkin disease, lymphoma, leukaemia, sarcoidosis) Low protein states Improper storage of tuberculin
ColumnB: Incorrect interpretation of reaction Previous BCG vaccination Infection with non-tuberculosis mycobacteria Incorrect method of TST administration Incorrect bottle of antigen used
